intro: Campylospermum glaberrimum, commonly known as the smooth campylospermum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a glossy appearance. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
